item.title: Delete this
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“mousamsh, post:5, topic:545913”]Do you wish to take a look at my source?

Im not sure if this code is correct

if (npcKills == 50) {
c.getItems().addItem(995, 100000);
c.sM(“You have been awarded 1M for killing 50 NPCs”);
break;
}[/quote]

Neither am I. And I have no interest in looking at your entire source to figure out what you have to do. But the code you posted seems like it would be sufficient. There are some things to consider though with your code:

  1. If the have no room in their inventory, what do you do?
  2. If they do have room in their inventory, but not enough to add 1m, what do you do?
  3. If you decide to move it to their bank if they are out of room in their inventory, what do you do if the bank is full, or does not have enough room in the stack to add 1m?

Read full topic

item.title: Delete this
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

mousamsh:

I know how to do that, But I dont know which class to put it in!

None of us can tell you that. You know your source better than we do.

In my source, I have a NpcDeathEvent class and NpcDeathEventListener interface, and this could be accomplished by

public void onNpcDeath(NpcDeathEvent event) {
    final Npc npc = event.getNpc();
    final Player player = event.getPlayer();
    player.increaseNpcKillCount(1);
    if (player.getNpcKillCount() == 50) {
        player.getInventory().add(COINS, REWARD);
    }
}

Although, since you’re making an Achievement system, you should probably do something there instead.

public interface Achievement<T extends EventListener> {

    String getName();
    String getDescription();
    T getListener();
}
public class NpcDeathAchievement implements Achievement<NpcDeathEventListener>, NpcDeathEventListener {

    NpcDeathEventListener getListener() {
        return this;
    }

    @Override
    public void onNpcDeath(final NpcDeathEvent event) {
        // ...
    }
}

Read full topic

item.title: Delete this
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“mousamsh, post:1, topic:545913”]If working on an achievement System where Once you hit 50 NPC Kills, You are awarded 1m!
What I need help with is making it so it like

if (npcKills == 50)
I want it to be like from 50 NPC Kills to 99 NPC Kills

If you are capable of helping me, Id be glad to explain it even further

This is a 317 loading 614+ [PI]

Or |||||

Once the Player gets 50 NPC Kills, It automatically adds 1M Into his BANK

My skype: tonebawsjinx
Message me if you can help me[/quote]

All you have to do is break it down into logical steps

when a player kills an npc
  if the players kill count for npcs is 50
    give the player 1m coins

That would be a quick pseudo code example.

Read full topic
